page.title: 12New House Farm.
page.content: As part of the survey we decided to visit a farm in our zone.We went to New House Farm, Sibdon. The farm is owned by Mr. and Mrs. Bowen. First Mr.Bowen gave us a talk,then we had a look around the farm. Mr. Bowen has 90 acres of land,16 acres owned by him and 74 acres rented.He does not employ any workers relying on just a family work force.The land mainly consists of grassland which is used for grazing and harvesting silage.Mr. Bowen only uses one artificial fertiliser to improve the land which is nitrogen. There are 3 main buildings,a farmhouse,barn and milking parlour.The parlour is called a herring bone and can hold 10 cows at the most.Mr. Bowen has 70 British Friesians and 1 Hereford bull.
